column4: Anyone know how to install the Cricket A600 USB Modem in Kubuntu 10.04? I tried the whole flipflop.sh thing and while it outputted a lot of information. It didn't seem to add anything to Network Config. What am I doing wrong? Also, I only have one Cricket modem. So if I try this I have to d/c and r/c to post more.
If someone could just give me a link to a guide that works I'd appreciate it. I have some stuff to do in the yard. But later on I'll be able to work more on it.
Isn't menu list always in the same place?
Hmmm ok. I learned someothing yay.
I need to know that as well Sir_Konrad
I would think it was 32. But not sure.
Most of the time if you don't know then it's 32 bit, but I have so much things going on I probably knew a few months ago! XD
mine is i686 is a 32 bit proc. x86_64 is always 64-bit.
What's the point in keeping an old version old? Why not upgrade?
Are you talking about why I would consider getting 10.04 for this MacBook?
Cricket calls it broadband. But it's quite a bit slower than that.
oh you're hooking up via ethernet?
Well he said that reinstalling works temporarily but then after a few boots it's hosed again.
